text: Crisp grass aroma. Hazy golden body with a modest head that fades quickly. Mild grain malt taste. Clean finish and refreshing.
Draft at Duckfat. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves a lot of lacing in the jar. Has a nice grass note on the nose. Pretty grassy on the tongue as well. Finished clean. Very nice.

Draught at Townshend, 2/11/17.Good clarity in this sparklingly-carbonated, pale-flaxen blonde beer. White head atop is medium-sized and dense.Light cereal grains in the nose mix with dusty hops, a touch of lemon-lime and plenty of fresh grass. Clean, seemingly well-attenuated from the nose and with delicate hints of honey and buttercream (not diacetyl-induced). Hops are a little more prominent than in a traditional pilsner, but not by much and I assume its more due to the relative freshness than any intention to Americanize this thing (also they are still Noble hop-like in character).Dry, lightly grainy with tight carbonation, tons of lemon and fresh grass and dainty cereal grains on the finish. A bit of sweat, sawdust and dust is the only detractor, though Id hardly even say its unwanted. Playful notes of honey, mineral and more freshly cut grass linger on the crisp, well-carbonated, dry finish.

Pour from a nice looking can. Pour is a hazy golden with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of cereals and light grass/herbs. Taste is pretty dry with more cereals, feeling lightly toasted. Body and carbonation were both average. Overall a pretty good micro pils and I have some pretty good memories of their IPL so Ill definitely need to check out Bunker more often!

Can from Julios. Pours out a hazy light golden color. Lacy off-white head. Flavor is crisp and bready with a slight bit of spice and fruit. Not really true to the style, but tasty overall and quite drinkable.

Pours hazy deep gold into a shaker. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving scant sheets. Sweet banana and caramel aromas. Dry with sour banana skin and caramel upfront turning to bitter earth in the lasting finish.

can. pours unclear light gold with a small creamy white cap offering some retention and lacing. grapey pilsner malts, hint of caramel, herbal-grassiness, touch of sugars, very clean yeast action. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; relatively dry but not crisp herbal finish. slightly under-attenuated - nice german attributes though.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Jimmy the Greeks (Old Orchard Beach, ME) au coût de 6,00$. Arôme: Légère odeur de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe de citron. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #7203)

Growler from Milk and Hops, Chelsea. Unclear golden pour with a thin head and light lace. Bread / dough, pale malt, grass, and spice. Clean, decently bitter close. Refreshing and quite drinkable, but didnt quite get to the crispness level of the best examples of this style. Still, theres a lot of flavor development and it is really drinkable. Pretty solid stuff.

On tap @ Bunker Brewing. Slightly hazed golden beer with a white head. Great bread and biscuit makes on the nose. Some floral and slightly grassy hops. Just a touch of bitterness to balance out the nice malt sweetness. Plenty of toasted biscuit. Good stuff.

Sampled at the brewery, pours a clear, dark gold with a ring of white head. Nose has grist, yeast, lemon, a little green hop. Flavor has malt, mild honey, mild peanut skin, lemon, straw. Finishes dry and crisp.
Can with label - pours orange gold white head - nose/taste of peppercorn, lemon and bread malts - medium body.

Covenhoven, Brooklyn can: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is lightly grass and some straw. Taste is clean and simple pilsener with a nice hoppy tinge and lightly sweet maltiness. Fine but unexciting.

LSAT Freedom Trip #139. Keg at the brewery. Hazy golden, large foamy white head, good retention. Aroma of biscuit malts and noble hops. The taste is bready malt, grains, grassy and noble hops. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness, well balanced.

Sample at Duckfat thanks to Chalumeaux. Pours Orange gold with a white head. Aroma is very bready, honey, mild floral hop. Taste... This is a well crafted, crisp pils with white bread, honey, moderate floral hop.
Poured from tap at Duckfat nice golden color with a one finger foamy white head. Aromas of Saaz grass floral notes and hop. Taste is grain hop and a nice balance. A good beer.

Dark orange colored 3 finger creamy white head. smells nice like a pils or kolsch. esters and a lot of clove and maybe cumin. Sparkling spritz mouthfeel. resinous finish but overall its fresh and tasty
draft at BCTC 2015, Great pils, well made, saaz, grassy, nice bitterness, golden pour, medium mouthfeel. nice pils

Draft @ BCTC, Ommegang Brewery. August, 8, 2015. Nice golden amber color, thin lasting head. Aroma is Saaz grassy goodness with some citrus. Fresh aroma! 
Great balance of sweet grain, Saaz hops and a light herbal touch. Mouthfeel is light and crisp, finish is clean. Really great and finely crafted example of the style.
Tap at source. Pours hazy yellow, frothy white head. Aroma is light pilsner malt. Light wheat and citrus notes. Taste is similar. Solid as far as pilsners go. But still just that.

Draft sample at Bunker. Clear yellow, foamy white head. Grassy, grainy, crackers, bread crust. Excellent representation of the style. Loved it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Brouwerij Lane. Pours clearish light amber with small head. Aroma is bread, dough, rye spice, earthy hops, grapefruit peel, herbs, lemon peel, light pine. Taste is biscuit and caramel with slight orange peel, spice, and earthy hops. On the malty side, but not too heavy.
Draught @ Coopers Craft Kitchen Chelsea. Clear rich yellow with large foamy off-white head, very little malt aroma, high carbonation, crisp malt taste, medium dry finish. Nice pilsner.

Clear gold Amber with a thin white head. Gran and sweet cracker. Crisp and grainy. Sweet and cracker filed into the finish.
Soft bitterness. Tasty and easy.
Nice pilsener on tap at bunker. Spicy grassy hop bite on a crisp cracker and biscuit malt backbone. Highly drinkable and my favorite of the 3 beers they had on draft.
On draft at brewery, clean malty pilsner, rich creamy Czech flavors, pretty good a little chemically and disjointed but ok
Draft at Salvage. Pours a clean pale golden color with a finger or two of white foam. Nose is bready with a touch of spicy grass. Palate is crisp clean and focused.
Des notes de céréales évidentes enrobées dune couche de gazon frais. Pas désagréable mais certainement pas mémorable.
UPDATED: SEP 22, 2013 Tap offering. Remenicent of pilsner urkel. Pleasant clean cracker biscuit malts. Soft herbs. Rustic wet hay. Nice body. Lifts.

Draught @ Brewery: This one poured a clear golden color. There was almost no head or lacing associated with it. The aroma was lighter, but still good. Some malts, as well as some earthy hops and a hint of spices. The taste is good. Some hop bite, a medium body, malts, some earthy hops and a hint of spiciness. Easy drinking. Not bad!

My Bottom Line:
Bread dough envelops herbal hops and their bitterness, while citrusy edges nudge this brew into quaffing territory.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam tops the cloudy beige.
-The yeast tended to take over the delicate malt and hop tandem, casting a shadow on the styles usual crispness.
-Drinkability could be higher.
-This is a nice brew, but it is not really what I want in a Pils.

On tap at Eventide Oyster Co, Portland.
